post.description:
Check if a doctor is available on a specific date or date range and suggest alternatives.

Args:
    request: Availability check request containing doctor name and date(s)
    session: Database session (injected by FastAPI)
    
Returns:
    TimeSlotResponse for single day queries, AvailabilityCheckResponse for date range queries
    
Raises:
    404: Doctor not found
    422: Invalid date format
    500: Database error

schema.title: Response Check Availability Bland Doctors Check Availability Post

post.description:
Get available dates for a doctor for the next 7 days.
Now uses the unified check_availability function with date range.

Args:
    request: Weekly availability request containing clinic ID and doctor ID
    session: Database session (injected by FastAPI)
    
Returns:
    AvailabilityCheckResponse with available dates in the next 7 days
    
Raises:
    404: Doctor not found
    500: Database error

Validate if a patient exists in the system using phone number and date of birth.

Args:
    request: Patient validation request containing DOB and phone
    
Returns:
    PatientResponse with validation result
    
Raises:
    422: Invalid date format or missing required fields
    500: Database error
Create a new guardian record in the system.

Create a new patient record in the system.

Args:
    request: Patient creation request containing first name, DOB, and phone
    
Returns:
    PatientResponse with creation result and new patient ID
    
Raises:
    422: Invalid input data or missing required fields
    500: Database error
Get a patient record from the system using phone number and date of birth.

Create a new refill request for a patient.

This endpoint allows creating a refill request with the following information:
- patient_id: The ID of the patient the request is for
- caller_name: Name of the person making the request
- relationship_to_patient: How the caller is related to the patient (optional)
- request: Details of the refill request

Args:
    request: RefillRequest containing all necessary information
    session: Database session (injected via FastAPI dependency)
    
Returns:
    RefillRequest with the newly created request ID
    
Raises:
    422: Invalid input data or patient doesn't exist
    500: Database error

Book a new appointment. If the slot is taken, it suggests alternatives.

Args:
    request: Appointment booking request
    session: Database session (injected by FastAPI)
    
Returns:
    AppointmentBookingResponse with booking result
    
Raises:
    404: Doctor not found
    422: Invalid appointment data or slot unavailable
    500: Database error

    session: Database session (injected by FastAPI)
    
Returns:

Raises:
    404: Appointment or doctor not found
    422: Invalid appointment data or slot unavailable
    500: Database error

Args:
    clinic_id: Optional clinic ID to filter data
    doctor_id: Optional doctor ID to filter data
    session: Database session (injected by FastAPI)

Returns:

Raises:

Get comprehensive dashboard statistics including:
- Total patients count
- Total doctors count
- Total appointments count
- Today's appointments count
- Recent appointments (last 5)
- Upcoming appointments count

Args:
    clinic_id: Optional clinic ID to filter data
    doctor_id: Optional doctor ID to filter data
    session: Database session (injected by FastAPI)

Returns:
    JSON response with comprehensive dashboard statistics
    
Example Response:
    {
        "stats": {
            "total_patients": 248,
            "total_doctors": 2,
            "total_appointments": 257,
            "todays_appointments": 11,
            "recent_appointments": [
                {
                    "id": 278,
                    "patient_name": "Ethan Patel",
                    "doctor_name": "Dr. David Green",
                    "appointment_time": "1989-09-18 11:00"
                }
            ],
            "upcoming_appointments": 29
        }
    }
    
Raises:
    500: Database error

Returns:
    JSON response with reminder status
    
Raises:
    404: Appointment not found
    400: Appointment not eligible for reminder (not scheduled, no phone number, etc.)
    500: Database error or reminder sending failure

get.description:
Initiate OAuth connection for a provider.

Args:
    provider: OAuth provider (google/microsoft)
    doctor_id: Doctor ID
    session: Async session
    token: Token
Returns:
    RedirectResponse: Redirect to OAuth provider

Handle OAuth callback from provider (both success and error cases).

Args:
    provider: OAuth provider (google or microsoft)
    code: Authorization code (present on success)
    state: State parameter containing doctor_id (present on success)
    error: Error code (present on failure, e.g., 'access_denied')
    error_description: Human-readable error description (optional)
    
Returns:
    RedirectResponse: Redirect to frontend with appropriate status

delete.description:
Disconnect a specific calendar account.

Args:
    provider: OAuth provider (google/microsoft)
    doctor_id: Doctor ID
    account_id: Account ID to disconnect
    
Returns:
    Success message

put.description:
Set a specific calendar account as primary for availability checks.
Only the primary calendar is used when checking doctor availability.
Events are still synced to all connected calendars.

Args:
    provider: OAuth provider (google/microsoft)
    doctor_id: Doctor ID
    account_id: Account ID to set as primary
    
Returns:
    Success message with updated primary status

post.description:
Check if the physician is available on a given date.
Rejects requests for dates in the past (compared to today, server time).

Validate if a patient exists in the system using first name, last name, and date of birth.

This endpoint searches for an existing patient in the Athena system using their personal information.
It returns whether the patient was found and their patient ID if available.

Parameters:
- first_name: First name of the patient
- last_name: Last name of the patient  
- date_of_birth: Date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format

Returns:
- found: Boolean indicating if patient was found
- patient_id: Patient ID if found, null otherwise
- error: Error message if any issue occurred

Create a new patient in the Athena system.

This endpoint creates a new patient record in the Athena system with the provided information.
All required fields must be provided, while optional fields have default values.

Required Parameters:
- first_name: First name of the patient
- last_name: Last name of the patient
- date_of_birth: Date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format
- mobile_phone: Mobile phone number
- department_id: Department ID

Returns:
- message: Status message indicating creation result
- patient_id: Patient ID if created successfully, null otherwise

Schedule a new appointment in the Athena system.

This endpoint creates a new appointment in the Athena system with the specified details.
All required parameters must be provided for successful appointment creation.

Required Parameters:
- patientId: ID of the patient for whom the appointment is being scheduled
- appointmentDate: Date of the appointment in YYYY-MM-DD format (must be a future date)
- appointmentTime: Time of the appointment in HH:MM format

Optional Parameters (with defaults):
- practiceId: Practice ID (default: 195900)
- providerId: Provider ID (default: 1)
- departmentId: Department ID (default: 1)
- appointmentTypeId: Appointment type ID (default: 008)

Returns:
- appointmentId: Unique identifier of the created appointment
- appointmentType: Type of appointment (e.g., "New Patient Appointment")
- duration: Duration in minutes
- date: Appointment date in MM/DD/YYYY format
- time: Start time in HH:MM format
- departmentId: Associated department ID
- providerId: Assigned provider ID
- patientId: Linked patient ID

Retrieve appointments for a specific patient from Athena.

This endpoint fetches all appointments associated with a specific patient from the Athena system.
The patient ID should be obtained from either the patient creation or validation endpoints.

Required Parameters:
- patientId: ID of the patient whose appointments to retrieve (obtained from patient creation/validation)
- practiceId: Practice ID to search for appointments

Returns:
A JSON object containing a list of appointments with the following fields:
- appointmentId: Unique identifier of the appointment
- appointmentType: Type of appointment (e.g., "New Patient Appointment")
- duration: Duration in minutes
- date: Appointment date in MM/DD/YYYY format
- time: Start time in HH:MM format
- departmentId: Associated department ID
- providerId: Assigned provider ID
- patientId: Linked patient ID

Cancel an existing appointment in the Athena system.

Args:
- appointmentId: ID of the appointment to cancel
- practiceId: Practice ID of the practice where the appointment is being scheduled
- patientId: ID of the patient who is being scheduled for the appointment

Returns:
- message: Cancellation result message
- appointmentId: ID of the cancelled appointment
- status: Status of the cancelled appointment

Reschedule an existing appointment in the Athena system.

Args:
- appointmentId: ID of the appointment to reschedule
- practiceId: Practice ID of the practice where the appointment is being rescheduled
- patientId: ID of the patient who is being rescheduled for the appointment
- appointmentDate: Date of the appointment in yyyy-mm-dd format (must be a future date)
- appointmentTime: Time of the appointment in HH:MM format
- providerId: Provider ID (default: 1)
- departmentId: Department ID (default: 1)
- appointmentTypeId: Appointment type ID (default: 1)

Returns:
- message: Rescheduling result message
- newAppointment: New appointment details
- status: Status of the rescheduled appointment

get.description:
This is the redirect_uri endpoint.
Practice Fusion will redirect here with ?code=AUTHORIZATION_CODE&state=STATE
Mirth calls this to retrieve the stored authorization code.
Root endpoint.
Health check endpoint.

Generate and return a randomly generated UUID for Epic callback.

Returns:
    JSON with generated UUID
    
Raises:
    500: Internal server error
